metadata.title: Convert BTU per Hour to Watts – Power Converter
metadata.description: Convert power output from BTU per Hour (BTU/h) to Watts (W), useful for HVAC and heating system specifications.

introduction: This converter transforms heating and cooling power ratings from BTU per hour to watts, enabling system comparison.
HVAC systems use BTU/h while modern appliances specify power in watts.
This converter uses the relationship where approximately 3.412 BTU/h equals 1 watt.
methodology: 1 W ≈ 3.412 BTU/h. To convert BTU/h to watts, divide by 3.412.
HVAC specifications traditionally use BTU/h; modern systems increasingly use watts for consistency.
Understanding BTU/h to watts conversion is essential for selecting heating and cooling equipment.
This converter provides accurate power conversion for HVAC planning.
examples: Example 2 – Small AC unit: 6,000 BTU/h ≈ 1,758 watts.
Example 3 – Large HVAC system: 36,000 BTU/h ≈ 10,550 watts.

faqs.question: What is BTU/h used for?
faqs.answer: Heating and cooling system power rating, traditional in HVAC industry.

faqs.question: How do I size an AC unit?
faqs.answer: Rule of thumb: 20 BTU/h per square foot. 1,000 sq ft = 20,000 BTU/h.

faqs.question: What's the difference between BTU and BTU/h?
faqs.answer: BTU is energy. BTU/h is power (energy rate). BTU/h measures heating/cooling rate.

faqs.question: How efficient is modern HVAC?
faqs.answer: SEER rating (Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio) indicates AC efficiency. Higher SEER = more efficient.

faqs.question: What does AFUE mean for furnaces?
faqs.answer: Annual Fuel Utilization Efficiency. 95% AFUE means 95% of fuel energy heats your home.

faqs.question: Can I install my AC myself?
faqs.answer: Professional installation recommended. Requires refrigerant handling and electrical expertise.

faqs.question: What size generator do I need?
faqs.answer: Calculate wattage of all devices. Generator should be 20% larger. Convert AC BTU/h to watts for calculation.

faqs.question: How often should I service HVAC?
faqs.answer: Spring and fall maintenance recommended. Annual filter replacement minimum.
